Pykaryote Documentation¶

This documentation aims to be a comprehensive guide to Pykaryote, a computer model for simulating the evolution of biological complexity. It serves as a guide for both users and developers.

Tutorial¶

The tutorial introduces the Pykaryote model and describes how to install and run Pykaryote.

  • Introduction
    • What is Pykaryote
    • Scientific Background
  • Installing Pykaryote
    • Supported Platforms
    • Dependencies
    • Installing (Linux)
    • Installing (Other Platforms)
  • Running Pykaryote
    • Setting Up Simulations
    • Simulations and Comparisons
    • Command Line Tools
    • Deprecated Scripts
  • Using Petri
    • Running with MPI
    • The run Command
    • The batch Command
    • The graph Command
  • Deprecated Scripts
    • pyk-run
    • pyk-mass_run
    • pyk-analyze
    • pyk-compare
    • pyk-comparison-graph

Developer Guide¶

This guide is for developers who wish to contribute to Pykaryote. It describes the tools and work flow associated with modifying and building Pykaryote.

  • Installing for Development
    • Installing Dependencies
    • Getting the Source Code
    • Building
    • Testing
  • Package Contents
    • Root Directory
    • Pykaryote Package
  • Development Workflow
    • Git
    • Coding Style
    • Adding Configuration Options
    • Unit Testing
    • Profiling
    • Documentation
    • Packaging for Release

Reference Manual¶

This document describes the design of Pykaryote. It provides a detailed description of Pykaryote’s organisms, their genomes and configuration options, as well as a high level description of the program design.

  • The Model in Depth
    • Terms
    • The Life of an Organism
    • Genome
  • Simulation Configuration Files
    • Configuration Options
  • Analyzer Data File Format
    • The Analyzer Directory
    • The Comparative-Analyzer Directory
  • Other Configuration Files
    • Comparison Configuration Files
    • Petri Settings Configuration Files
    • Petri Batch Configuration Files
  • Modules
    • Pykaryote.sim
    • Pykaryote.petri
    • Pykaryote.utils
    • Pykaryote.test
